Uses of Class
network.Node

  • Packages that use Node 
    Package Description
    network  

    • Uses of Node in network

      Fields in network declared as Node 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Node Node.dijkstraPrev
      the predecessor of this node when the origin is implicitly given by the last node that dijkstra's algorithm was run on.
      Fields in network with type parameters of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Node> Network.nodes
      This hashmap indexes the set of network nodes by their integer ID.
      Methods in network that return Node 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node Network.getNode(int nodeID)
      The preferred way of recalling the node with ID nodeID.
      Methods in network with parameters of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int Node.compareTo(Node o)
      Nodes are naturally ordered by dijkstraDist to enable use of a minimum-priority queue.
      boolean Network.dijkstraMinPriorityQueue(Node originNode)
      An efficient implementation of the dijkstra algorithm using a augmented min-priority queue with a mapped binary heap.
      private void Network.drawEdge(Node from, Node to, double circleRadius, int type)
      private method used by draw to draw edges
      private void Network.drawNode(Node node, double circleRadius)
      Private method used by Network.draw(int, int) to draw nodes.
      Edge Network.getEdge(Node tail, Node head)
      This another acceptable way of recalling edges, replacing getEdge(int); slightly faster is the mapping by integer ID, see Network.getEdge(int, int).
      private void Network.initializeDijkstraMinPriorityQueue(java.util.AbstractQueue<Node> Q, java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> Qbuddy, java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> destinations, int originNodeID, Node originNode)
      Inititialization of the Dijkstra algorithm for improved brevity and readability.
